HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that includes Microsoft Intune.

From the Microsoft Intune admin center, you add the apps shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to configure the apps to meet the following requirements:

• App1 must automatically install for all users in the marketing department on any Windows 11 device enrolled in Intune. If a user receives a new device, App1 must install automatically.
• App2 must be available for download for any user in the HR department from a personal Android device that is not enrolled in Intune.

Which assignment should you configure for each app? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: if anyone have recently given the test, could you provide me with some info of the test like, test was difficult or moderate, MDT questions were there or not?

According to me,
App1: A required assignment to a user group.
App2: An Available assignment to a user group.

......If a user receives a new device, App1 must install automatically. > Means that App1 should be assigned to a group of devices. 


.... from a personal Android > App2 should be assigned to a user group.

SO correct answers are:
App1: A required assignment to a device group.
App2: An Available assignment to a user group.

comments.content: Personally I think App1 should be assigned to s User group as well, so when a user signs in to a new device, it gets the app installed, regardless of the device.

App1 (Microsoft 365 app for Windows): A Required assignment to a user group
Reasoning: App1 needs to install automatically for users in the marketing department on Windows 11 devices. A required assignment ensures automatic installation. Since the requirement is based on users belonging to the marketing department, a user group assignment is appropriate. Intune will handle the installation on any Windows 11 device associated with that user.

App2 (Line of Business app for Android): An Available assignment to a user group
Reasoning: App2 should be available for download for users in the HR department on personal Android devices that are not enrolled in Intune. An available assignment allows users to choose to download and install the app themselves. Since it's for users in HR, a user group assignment is correct. Because the devices are personal and not enrolled, Intune cannot require the installation. The user must initiate the download.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You have a Windows device named Device1 that is enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

On January 1,2024, you assign an app named App1 to Device1 as a required app.

The install of App1 fails.

What is the next date that Intune will attempt to install App1?

comments.content: When an app installation fails, Intune follows a specific retry logic. Initially, it will attempt to install the app three times, with each attempt spaced 5 minutes apart. If all three of these rapid attempts fail, Intune will then switch to retrying the installation once every 24 hours.

Cloud Policy service for Microsoft 365 lets you enforce policy settings for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise on a user's device, even if the device isn't domain joined or otherwise managed. When a user signs into Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise on a device, the policy settings roam to that device. Policy settings are available for devices running Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android, although not all policy settings are available for all operating systems.
